page.title: 20Threave Rovers Football Club
page.content: Threave Rovers Football Club was founded in the 1950's. An extension was built onto the club house in 1973. The club was built to foster football in Castle Douglas and the South of Scotland. Threave Rovers have won three cups in the last three years. Mr David McLean is chairman and has been for ten years. Ian Bendall is the Manager and Eric Houston is the Secretary. There are about 16 players. The football pitch has always been where it is at the bottom of Castle Douglas across from the Scout Hall and beside the Ambulance Station. Threave Rovers have appeared twice in the Scottish Cup. They have also played in the final of the Western Amateur Cup.
